text: I'm not a super fan of Chinese food but I am a sucker for a a good Hainanese chicken and this place has it. The accompanying ginger-scallion dipping sauce and rice put it over the top. It was a cold Saturday in Vegas and this place hit the spot especially with the chicken noodle soup. Very limited menu which isn't a problem when the main dishes are good.

Everything here is excellent! The soup in particular was exceptional! Literally the best chicken noodle soup ever! I added dark meat and it was incredible. I definitely recommend! If you're wondering what to get, try the soup, it's spectacular!

We came here for lunch and it wasn't busy.  Staffs were friendly and cheerful.

We ordered two set lunch and the chicken was good but not as authentic as I had hoped for.  It came with three different kind of dipping sauce and a bowl of the rice cooked in chicken broth.

Be warned if you plan to bring your young ones as they serve pretty much chicken and chicken.  Not much choices or a vegetarian dish.  This place also closes early so be sure to call if you are thinking of a late night snack.

Overall, we would return and partly due to its location.
Best hainan chicken in Vegas.   Deliciously simple!   Rice is moist and flavorful while the chicken is fresh amd accompanied wondwefully by the dipping sauces. So happy Nuro opened up!

This place has the lagit hainan chicken! Their chicken with the yellow skin is is the best type of range free chicken. I love the texture and well done. Their rice and ginger sauce is amazing, but I didn't care for their other two sauces that come with the rice dish as it is too sour too my taste bud. Hopefully, they added more dishes in the future  menu as well.

Came here to pick up some lunch after an appointment. Heard about this place soon after opening either by friends/eater/yelp/etc and was interested because it was a restaurant that specialized in Hainan Chicken Rice. 

Up until now, I have tried various places around town such as Big Wong with their highly popular hainan chicken rice for the cheap. Also from Flock n Fowl, who is another specialized Hainan Chicken Rice restaurant, open only during lunch hours, and use american free range chicken. Before Nuro opened, Flock n Fowl was by far "the best in Las Vegas", but that may not be saying much since its Vegas.. Lol Both serving Sinaporean/Malaysian styles. One other mentionable is not in LV but in LA named Savoy, which serves a Thai style Hainan Chicken rice. That was the best in that style, not avail in LV.

Like Flock n Fowl, Nuro has weird hours as well, open only from 11am - 6pm, closed Tuesdays. 

Their menu is fairly simple.

Main Entrees - 
Chicken Noodle Soup $8.95 - Rice noodle soup w/ poached fresh free-range chicken, bean sprout, cilantro, scallion, and a side of spicy Nuro sauce

Extra add-on's for NOODLES include Cloud Ear Mushroom +$0.75, Spicy Nuro Sauce +$0.75, Extra Side Noodle +$4.50 (ouch...)

Hainan Chicken Rice $9.75 - Poached fresh free-range richen served with stock flavored rice and a side of house soy sauce, ginger scallion sauce, and spice Nuro sauce.

Extra add-on's for RICE include Flavoured Rice +$2.50, Ginger Scallion Sauce +$0.75, House Soy Sauce +$0.50

Both options are served with skin. Noodles w/o bones. Rice w/ bones. +$1 for dark meat option. 

Side Orders - 
"Sliced Bean Curd in Spicy Sauce" $4.50
"Seasonal Vegetable - Yu-Choy with Oyster sauce" $4.99 (wait what... thats not seasonal..)
"Fresh Cucumber w/ garlic vinaigrette" $4.50
"Cloud Ear Mushroom w/ light red chili sauce" $4.50
"Nuro Chicken Wings w/ spicy lime sauce - 6 pcs" $7.99
"Braised Pig Ears w/ garlic red vinegar sauce" $4.59

Chicken Only served w/ skin, bones, and ginger scallion sauce
1/4 Breast Meat $6.50
1/4 Dark Meat: +$1

1/2 Chicken - $13.99
Whole Chicken $22.99

Beverages 
Hong Kong Style Lemon Iced Sweet Tea (w/ Refills) $3.50
Hot Jasmine Tea (per cup) $1.75
Fresh Soy Milk (chilled) $2.50
Soda $1.50
Bottled Water $1.25
Vietnamese Drip Coffee $3.50

------------

I had ordered the Hainan Chicken Rice w/ dark meat option. One of the waiters had let me try their daily fresh brewed HK style iced tea. Since it was just a sample, there was no lemon but he had described it as something i've drank since I was a kid. Cup of tea with a few slices of lemon on the bottom that u poke/crush with a spoon and drink all together. Unfortunately, their tea is already sweetened. It reminded me of Raising Cane's sweet tea, if thats any basis on how sweet it was. 

After returning home, I had ate this almost immediately. I only live about 5 minutes or less away so it was a short period of time. The order is served in a plastic bento style box. You get a decent amount of the flavored rice seasoned with chicken stock and ginger, pickled cucumber, carrots, and radish, and of course the chicken. It being a free-range chicken, and as one who buys it fairly frequently from a local chicken shop, I had known that typically free-range chickens are smaller w/ less meat, but with that trade, you get a much more "chewy" and flavorful chicken. 

The chicken itself seemed quite similar to how my family or chinese restaurants do it. ??? (Empress Chicken) or ??? (White Cut Chicken - is there another name for this?) I am used to eating chicken on the bone so this didn't bother me. Wished for more meat but i went into order dark meat knowing I probably wouldn't be getting much compared to the white/breast meat option. One complaint though is their knife does not do well in cutting the bones. I struggled with picking out shards more than eating the chicken. Not good for the in-experienced. For free-range chicken, the meat could be a bit more chewy. It was a bit too soft. Almost thought it was more like frozen chicken vs free range. 

The sauces that came with the chicken was good. The ginger scallion sauce was a bit plain. Lacking some salt. Otherwise good. Their Spicy Nuro sauce was delicious with its chopped garlic and chili w/ a vinegar base. Adds a nice kick to it all. Their house soy sauce was the one i touched once and never went to again. Lol 

The rice was nice and flavorful but wished it was cooked less. It was a bit mushy and breaking apart. Any more liquid and it would have turned into a thick porridge. Ha ! I like my rice to be mildly firm with a mild chew and individually grained. 

Overall, okay place. Lots more to work on. Hope they improve over time. Maybe have a boneless option for the not so experienced American-born xD
Love the chicken. I like boneless and the owner told me they can make both ways, with or without bones!!!!

W-O-W! Nuro bistro exceeded my expectations! Being from the SGV area, many people rave about Savoy for their Hainan chicken rice dish, but they have NOTHING on Nuro! 

APPETIZERS
Pig ear: yummy! A light flavor,  not too heavy. Nothing much to say except that I highly recommend it if you're okay with pig ear!

Cloud ear mushroom: FINALLY A CLOUD MUSHROOM  THAT IS BITE-SIZED. Very refreshing dish and cut small enough where it doesn't get all over my face. 

Fried Chicken wings: If not the first two,  GET THIS. The batter was different from other wings that I've had before and it was good!! The lemon/lime sauce that it comes with is really good too

The rice: a huge part that makes or breaks the Hainan chicken dish is the rice. It was so good that I ordered seconds...and really wanted to order thirds if my tummy wasn't about to burst. I still regret not ordering a third to go. 

The noodles: I can't complain.  The broth was near perfect! Not too salty, but not too flavorless. My mom did say she wished it was a tad more salty, but you're just going to have to try!

The chicken: TEN.DER. I opted to pay +$1 for dark meat for both the rice and noodle dishes and it was SO worth it. The flavor complemented the rice perfectly without having either one overpower the flavor of the other

The sauces: YES!!!!!!!! They give 3 sauces with the rice dish: ginger-scallion(?), garlic-something, and a light soy sauce that tastes really similar to the dim sum cheung fun [rolled noodle] sauce. They're all pretty different, but they work well together and separately.

Service itself gets five stars. Very friendly, very accommodating. No complaints!!

TL;DR 
I salivated writing this review and now I'm sitting here 4 hours away from the restaurant wishing they could have opened in LA instead. I'm coming here every time I visit LV and so should you!

The Hainan chicken is amazing here. The sauces were delicious and the stock rice was very flavorful. All the ingredients were fresh, and the location was clean. I'd definitely be coming back. In comparison to their local rival flock and fowl, the prices were more reasonable here, the staff was friendly, and the food/overall experience was better.

One of the best chicken and rice I have had in a long time. Service is awesome.. Got the chicken noodle soup my date liked the chicken noodle soup but I prefer the rice since I'm ABC. They explained everything  and is very detailed. The pig ear we ordered was like when I was kid in San Francisco Chinatown. We liked it so much that we ordered food to take home..

Great and attentive service- glad I tried their recommendations. I got the chicken wings and mushroom salad to start with. Both were delicious, I was especially impressed with the mushroom salad! I'm not a fan of mushrooms, but the texture and sauce used with the cloud ear mushrooms was perfect. I also had the free range Hainan chicken with dark meat (I recommend ordering it without bones- you can also order breast meat) it came with the most delicious side of rice that had been cooked with chicken broth. I've had Hainan chicken before that depended on the sauces for flavor- this chicken on its own was great and the 3 different sauce options that came with, really complemented and elevated its flavor. Fantastic lunch/ early dinner spot !!!

Don't be like me and park across from the daycare center. Nuro Bistro only has one main entrance, so we had to walk around the building to get into the restaurant. I know it's not that big of a deal, but the Vegas summer heat is real!!

We ordered two dark meat chicken plates and the cloud ear mushroom. Service was very very fast. I love cloud ear mushroom because of the crunchy bite; their spin on this dish was very refreshing. In terms of the chicken plate, we were pleasantly surprised. Each plate comes with three sauces, and my favorite was definitely the sweet/sour sauce. The rice also had a slight hint of chicken stock. My biggest gripe would be that the chicken still had bones in them; having to pick out the bones mid-chew was kind of annoying. The chicken was a bit boring by itself (but that's what the sauces are for). 

All in all, I would come back when I have a hankering for a chicken plate. Often, I've found that Hainan chicken restaurants tend to neglect the sauces/rice, so I'm glad that they're pretty spot on at Nuro!

Tried because of all the rave reviews.... Don't know what I got  but totally not what the reviews said. $12 for 5 pieces of skin and rice.  Flavor was OK... But  totally Not worth it. Don't wanna bash, but coming from NY this was a big disappointment. For me... Never trying again...

Found this place on Yelp while visiting in Vegas. I'm from LA so I've had a lot of good Hainan chicken from Savoy, Green Zone and Side Chick.

This place blows those places away.

The quality of the chicken is probably some of the best I've ever had. The server told me they use fresh chicken and you can definitely tell. The texture of the chicken was amazing.

I also ordered the cucumber salad and sliced bean curd (this one is spicy) and they were both great as well.

This place is truly a hidden gem in Las Vegas with Asian food better than most places in the 626.

This place is very clean and has lots of room. They only sell soup and this soup is delicious. The only problem I have is is that it is very expensive soup. For the ingredients that the soup contains and being only chicken soup with noodles. Unfortunately if they would lower their price and not the quality more people could afford to go.

Our new favorite chicken rice spot! 

We order the poached chicken boneless and ask for a side of the bone broth. The organic chicken is so tender you can cut it with a spoon, and just bursting with good ol' chicken flavor. It's hard to find good organic, antibiotic-free chicken in this city and I come here just cause of that. The accompanying rice, also packed with flavor, makes for a very satisfying meal and stands out. They certainly did it right!

Broth is just so clean, not oily at all but full of chicken flavor. Devoid of any ginger flavor which some may like. Wish they add it as an option for a side cause I have to have it on the side, always. The pickled veggies on the side are addicting as well and again, I wish I could order and pay for more as a side lol not too sweet, not too tart.

LOVE the Hong Kong lemon iced tea and they're generous with the refills. 

Have yet to try the wings and other side dishes since just the entree we order gets filling enough.

Service here is great; we always see John who gives outstanding service and it's a pleasure to chat with him. 
Establishment is very clean, artistically decorated and you don't ever feel rushed.

Yay for pugs!!!

Their Hainan Chicken is the bomb! 
I ordered the Hainan dark meat chicken and it comes with rice and 3 sauces. I also tried their braised pig ears with garlic vinagarette. 

If you are looking for a comfort meal, friendly atmosphere with a homey vibe--this place will not disappoint you. They've only been open for a month now and I wish that they will continue to be consistent with their food and their customer service. 

John, one of the server told me that they buy their chicken fresh everyday and also their veggies. A free range chicken in Las Vegas valley---that's awesome! Nothing is frozen which is really amazing.

I enjoyed my food and I took some home for my husband and he also liked it. I will come back to try their chicken noodle soup. 

Kudos guys for a wonderful meal and experience.

Spot On!!! Love the Hainanese Chicken. The dipping sauce were delicious.  The gingerly rice is moist and tasty.  Better than flock n fowl. Only drawback is they close at 6 pm.  Love the limited menu.  Quality control definitely!!! Support local restaurants.   Get the chicken wings and cucumber salad. Great service.

I was really excited when I heard this place serves Hainanese chicken rice. I was even more excited when I was told their decor was pug theme. What more could I ask for?? Anywho...I came with my mom and brother. We got: 

- 2 plates of the Hainanese chicken rice: by far my favorite dish. My mom makes a pretty bomb Hainan chicken rice dish so I was surprised with how happy my taste buds were when I ate this. You get 3 sauces to dip your chicken in (house soy sauce, ginger scallion, and spicy Nuro). My favorite were the ginger scallion and spicy Nuro sauce. 

- chicken noodle soup: this was eh. The broth was too bland for me. I would skip this next time. 

- Nuro chicken wings: This was okay. There was another review that mentioned it wasn't crispy and I have to agree. I mean...they're fried chicken wings, you would think they would be crispy? It was more on the soggy side. The flavor itself was great but maybe it needed to be fried a little bit longer? 

I also got to try the Hong Kong style lemon iced tea (free thanks to Yelp check-in!) and I enjoyed it. It was refreshing and wasn't overly sweet in my opinion. It also had a nice tang to it from the lemons. 

Shout out to John and Kyle. Both provided great service. John was our main server and he was excellent. He made sure our drinks were never emptied and did a great job of explaining the menu.

So would I be back? Yes! The Hainan chicken rice dish is the main reason why I'll be back. Also because I gotta support my fellow pug lovers.

Been a couple times here to Nuro bistro. Food is so fresh and love the soup I could eat it everyday.  You can tell they use fresh Ingredients and really care about what comes out of the kitchen.  It's a really clean place and the staff is very nice and helpful.  Prices are more then fair and will continuously be a repeat client my wife and I love this place its a nice break from all the places in China town and it's pretty clean and healthy eating

The food is so fresh. My new favorite is the Wonton soup. Very filling.  Very clean restaurant and the servers are very friendly.  Try their Hong Kong style lemon ice tea. You'll be surprised how refreshing it is. Goes great if you like your food spicy.

Yummm! 
I'm so glad this place has opened. I have been waiting for F&F to re-open because I've been craving Hainan chicken. No need to wait anymore since NURO BISTRO is here and closer to my side of town. 
I came for lunchtime and the server was very helpful and explained everything. I went with the braised pig ears which comes with a garlic vinegar sauce....soo good! Their Hainan chicken is absolutely delish. I had chose white meat but you can choose dark meat for a dollar more. Be careful because it's bone in. The rice that it comes with has got great flavor and comes with 3 sauces. My favorite sauce was the ginger scallion. I definitely want to try other items on the menu such as the chicken noodle soup, chicken wings, and their soy milk which is made fresh daily. Dont forget to check in to get your free drink. I went with the iced tea....it was light and refreshing (free refills). This place is a must try!

We visited Nuro twice in the current week and absolutely loved both offerings of the Noodle & Chicken - After dropping some knowledge from Tommy & Jess (the owners) we were so happy to know that they do not use any frozen chicken and pick up a whopping 15 pounds of chicken daily!

The soup and broth is incredibly tasty with no MSG :D

Keep it up guys, we'll be back for more!

This place has the best Hainan chicken rice ! Their free range chicken is very juicy & rice is seasoned to perfection!  Nuro sauce is tangy & delicious. Chicken wings were pretty awesome as well!! If you feel like something on the lighter side try their chicken noodle soup.  My husband loves their nuro sauce it's tangy and spicy! Ohh & did i mention Their soy milk is made fresh it's sooo refreshing
Awesome Hai Nan Chicken  they have great service absolutely delicious on the chicken with rice

This spot hands down has the freshest chicken and noodles in town!!!! The wonton soup was amazing and the tea is perfect!!! Very relaxed atmosphere and the staff is super friendly!!!! Definitely stop by and taste for yourself!!!

Guess what new business you have to be excited about? A new hot spot for hainan chicken has just popped up in Las Vegas!

Menu is downright simple. 2 mains and 6 side dishes to choose from. The chicken rice is the most flavorful I have tasted in America by far; chicken itself is moist, succulent, and juicy; broth for the chicken soup is pack full of flavor! Doesn't have a ginger taste like most places. 

TIP: If your bone picking skills is not on point, you can always ask to have the chicken boneless or skinless.

John is a great attentive server who is cheerful and friendly. Definitely a place I have bookmarked for future visits.

The Hoi Nan chicken rice is the best in town! Service was wonderful!  My wife and two kids liked their noodle soup and free ranch chicken. We tried the seasoned cucumbers and cloud ear mushrooms, taste to perfection!! The place was packed for their Hoi Nan chicken rice. Will be back for sure!!

How can a chicken and rice place run out of rice at 5 pm? Rice is half of what they do. Rice is cheap. MAke extra and you can reuse it. Really sorry I drove all the way across town to encounter a riceless chicken and rice place

I was born in Southeast Asia, and Singapore rice is a delicatessen comfort food.  I would have to say, Nuro was able to bring me back to my childhood years.   The chicken was soft, tender and juice.  The rice had a great balance in the fragrance.  It was not bland nor overbearing.  With so many ramen noodles restaurants popping up, this restaurant is a refreshing change.  Will be back without hesitation.

Excellent Hinan Chicken rice!!!!  No need to order anything else on the menu at this place!!  Swing on by and check it out.  You will not be disappointed!  Just make sure you park on the south side of the building.

We came here straight from the airport. The lady was so kind to offer their chairs for our luggage (duffle bags). We ordered the hainan chicken rice. Soo good  My wife's lemon iced tea never reached the bottom. They refilled it at least 4 times no questions asked. Everyone who works here is so attentive and kind. You can tell in their food and their actions that this is their passion. Whenever I'm in Vegas again I'll make sure to always come by!

Finally a place that serves Asian chicken noodle soup as hainan chicken rice!!! Food was great just like how it is back at home! Staff were very friendly and constantly asking if we needed refills on drinks and checking on us! A definitely must try place! Plenty of parking available! 

I will definitely be coming back here soon!!

I tried it!   Nice young servers with great attitude and energy gave me welcoming service.  I had the dark meat with flavored rice.  It was delicious.  I particularly loved the minced ginger scallion dipping sauce.  I grew up eating this sauce with steamed chicken in Hong Kong. They made it just like my mom did (my mom is an excellent cook).  Kids friendly.  Clean place. Good location without needing to drive down to Chinatown.  Will come back for sure.

Service was good, my drinks never left empty and our table got checked on often. The only thing I like out of 5 items I ordered was the hainanese chicken rice and the pig ear. Chicken wings was decent. The chicken noodle broth is a little bland to me. The mushroom dish off the app is too salty. Squeezed some lemon juice helps. Overall I'm happy with the meal. Definitely recommended their famous chicken rice.

If you want the cleanest and tastiest, steamed chicken in Vegas, stop by and order some at Nuro Bistro! Yes, the size of the chicken is smaller, but it's easy to notice the quality of the tender and flavorful meat (no MSG!) once you bite into it. I was feeling a little under the weather and was thinking about making some chicken rice soup, except I had no chicken. I wanted healthy, pre-cooked chicken, so that I could cook a quick, nourishing meal for myself. I remembered that Nuro Bistro specialized in Hainan chicken, and I decided to order just the whole chicken to go. When I got home, I ate a few pieces and was immediately surprised by the non-oily deliciousness of the skin and meat! No extra seasoning needed! I basically dumped the cut-up chicken into my home-made, soupy porridge, heated them together, and in about 15 minutes, I had the best, wholesome and hearty lunch that also helped me feel much better later in the day! 

I hope Nuro Bistro can stay in business because its location (across the street from the Mint Indian place) in a small, somewhat empty shopping plaza next to a tailor shop doesn't seem to attract a lot of people traffic. The cost of Nuro's chicken is a bit expensive, but not unreasonable for the higher quality of the product. I'm usually a fried chicken eater, but the steamed chicken here is so good that I could easily switch to the lighter, better-for-my-heart-and- arteries side! :D

I had the hainan chicken and the cloud ear mushroom salad. Both were delicious! 
It was my first time having hainan chicken. (I order the dark meat) The chicken was tender and came with 3 diff amazing sauces & rice cooked in chicken broth was mind blowing. I literally ate the whole thing and savored every single bite. 
I can't wait to go back to try rest of the menu. See you soon NURO bistro!

Not to be confused with Nuru  -  Nuro Bistro delivers silky smooth Hainan Chicken paired with a trio of house-made sauces which is probably just as good as a Nuru you can find on Spring Mtn -  but don't ask me b/c never had a true Nuru but I imagine it would be as delectable... 

Vegas is lucky to now have a pair of stellar Hainan Chicken purist options along with Flock & Fowl.   I'd go to F&F weekly if I could -  if I had to rate it I would rank Nuro slightly behind.   But that's not a bad thing.   This is like a 9.2 Vs. a 9.8-9.9.   Venus to Serena.

In true Asian form, there is a $1 upcharge for dark meat which has less meat.   We got both but it would be nice to be able to get a combo of white and dark.    The trio of sauces consisted of a sweet dark soy, your traditional ginger scallion, and a SPicy Nuro which was more vinegar base.

Service was great, food was probably 15% cheaper than F&F.   I will be a Nuru regular since it's much closer to where I live.   Next time will order the Chicken Soup and wings but based on how the Hainan Chicken is I wouldn't expect anything less than pure delish.   Between 2 people and a toddler, we ordered 3 orders of HN CHicken and some pig ears and we devoured it all - it was so good!
The flavor was there for the Hainanese Chicken Rice, but felt like I got more bones than actual chicken meat. Cloud ear mushrooms salad tasted OK nothing special.

I have never written a review because I can be quite critical, but I felt compelled this time due the excellent food and service that we experienced.  The food and sauces were just as good as how my Mom would make it.  The portions are sizable, and there is a great balance of the new and old with regards to the decor and the cuisine.  I would highly recommend this restaurant if you want a friendly, relaxed atmosphere to enjoy for a quick meal or a nice sit down family meal.  In fact, my daughter felt so relaxed that she couldn't resist the urge to prop her feet up and enjoy!  Last but not least: please note at how the owners even come out to greet us.  I would give this place 10 stars if I could.
This place is hands down the best place for chicken pho and chicken rice. The service is also great!

The best ???? I ever had.  

But, their menu is very small, ???? or ?? only!  

I would recommend it.

Chicken Noodle Soup is the bidness!!

Came in here the other day with my GF's dad to try the place out and ordered the Pig Ears, Hainan Chicken, Chicken Noodle Soup, and the Chicken Waaaaaaangs. 

Chicken wings were lightly battered and served with a light sweet/sour sauce. It had nice flavor and crispy exterior and juicy interior . 

Pig ears were surprisingly delicious. I ordered them just cause, and wasn't expecting much. But ihm yea, I was pleasantly surprise at the flavor of dish. These looked like they were hand cut and were sliced a bit thicker than what I am used too.
However, the thickness they cut it too gave it a nice chew that complimented the marinade that was used.

The Hainan chicken came with 3 sauces and bowl of rice. The chicken was tender, like really tender. When I got it I thought it was odd that the skin on the chicken was a lot more yellow than chickens I normally eat. I come to find out that they use all-natural chickys that they pick up daily. I thought that was a big plus. The Hainan rice was solid and executed perfectly . And you know in Hainan Chicken, it's all about that rice  .

The chicken noodle soup/pho was.... deliciously delightful. Seriously. The broth was light, yet flavorful. The noodles were cooked perfectly. And the chicken was tender. I picked up the bowl and drank that bish with my GF's dad there... and this is the first time me and him hung out with just the two of us. Honestly.. this may be the best chicken noodle soup I have tried. Just my personal opinion..

I definitely recommend giving this place a try. I think it's a good joint for a nice little lunch/ early dinner. The entrees are filling but not heavy. There are a few items I would like to try next time I go. I really want to try the different drinks they have like the soy milk and the lemon tea. I was on a calorie restriction the time I went, so I didn't get to try them.

Mmm.. what else... mmm .. the decor was nice. The restaurant looks brand new. The artwork was dope too. I was told the owner painted it?? I need to talk to them and commission them to do one for me too . The restrooms were good too. It was hella clean and smelled nice . 

Service was cool, they were really nice and would check up on us every so often. The place is fairly new, so I just think everyone is just getting the hang of things. 

But yea, if you liked this review hit the like button and share it with your friends. If you didn't please comment below. If you like what you see and want to be updated with new reviews,  hit the "SUBSCRIBE" button. 

If you want to hear my gf yell at me for not bringing her food from this place take a look at this clip:

https://clips.twitch.tv/TubularBoxyShallotUnSane?tt_medium=clips_api&tt_content=url

This place serves delicious Hainan chicken rice.  The staff are super polite and friendly. The restaurant is well designed and very cute. 

I can't wait to return.

Another Hainan chicken spot in Vegas? Cluck yea!
I love my Hainan chicken, and I was so happy when I discovered this place through yelp. 

Gonna get right to it. Got the Hainan chicken with dark meat, and it was excellent, very juicy and tender. I got it with the bone (I feel like it retains more flavor than the boneless). It comes with three sauces (ginger scallion, house soy, and spicy Nuro), and the ginger scallion was definitely my favorite one. They pick up their chicken daily and only use free-range chicken so their chicken is super fresh and of high quality! In addition, they don't use MSG here. 

Also tried a few of their appetizers including the cucumbers, spicy bean curd, and the chicken wings. The cucumbers were really refreshing and is a perfect appetizer for the summer. The spicy bean curd had a nice kick to it, and the wings weren't as crispy as I would have liked but were still tasty. The fish sauce that came with the wings complemented them very well. 

The restaurant is clean and modern. Service is great, and everyone is so friendly! I will definitely be back!

Went here a few days ago, the restaurant was pretty slow and we received prompt service. I ordered the Hainan Chicken. I've had Hainan Chicken in a few different places and I would have to say I was not the biggest fan of Nuro. The sauces were very bland in my opinion nothing that really stuck out. Also, I don't mind bones in my chicken but it seemed as if every other bite was bone. It's a little pricey for the amount of chicken you actually receive.

Had the chicken and rice. Was very good. Lots of skin and bones . Didnt feel much meat in meal. Overall very tasty and make sure to say not very sweet on the ice tea. It was overly sweet to my liking. Great ambience as well

Not my normal type of food that I eat but decided to give this spot a try and don't regret it!  The Nuro chicken wings were my favorite and the sauce that is served with it gives it that extra delicious kick.  The Hainan chicken with rice dish came with three different sauces to choose from which is great since I love dipping all my food in some type of sauce.  Very tender and peal right off the bone chicken!  I was served by Jess, who I believe is the one who came up with the pug theme, which gives the restaurant a lot of character.  She was awesome and very attentive.  My overall experience was one of a kind and I'll definitely be back!

Can't wait to come back for the chicken rice, and I bought three other friends this time!!! And of course, everyone loves loves the chicken rice!!!! ( their pig ear and wood ear are excellent)
Try the chicken noodle soup this time ( on top of the three appetizers,  the whole chicken and 6 bowls of chicken rice, hehe!!!) excellent job on the noodle!!! 
All the servers and the owner they are very very nice!! But want to say, server John u did an excellent job again!! Thanks for taking care of us today!!!
Me and My sister enjoy every bite of the hainam chicken rice and the ear salad so good the service awesome and thanks for the fresh lemonade ice tea , we will be back

I think this one of the best chicken place in las vegas. The chicken was flavorful and portion was good. service was excellent. i sure go back again to try the soup version and other small dish they have to offer.

Hainan Chicken is so yummy!! So fresh! Make sure you ask for soup to go with it. 

I have dark meat this time. Next time would try white meat too. Can't wait!!

They pick up free range chickens from the farm every morning, its fresh meat. The rice is fried before being boiled so it gives you a great al dente texture. It was so nice I had to eat it twice in one visit.

We enjoyed our dinner here a couple of days ago. They close at 8pm and we made it here at 7pm. The restaurant is cute and the menu is limited. The food was delicious, came out fast and served with a friendly smile.

The main dish is Hainan Chicken. Hainan Island sits off the south coast of China, and is often described as "China's Hawaii " and is famous for Hainan Chicken and not seafood. 
Their chicken is obtained fresh daily and is free rang and they also not cook with MSG.

We had the Hainan chicken rice with dark meat $11.75. The chicken is flavorful poached in simmering stock, then seasoned with spices, ginger and garlic, and used to cook the rice, giving it a rich, flavorful and chicken-imbued taste. The chicken is served with the rice and an array of delicious dipping sauces.

We also had chicken wings and it went well with the side of sauce. I want to return and try the other items on the menu.

The Best Hainan chicken you can ever have. 
I came here two days in a row. 
Chicken cook perfect and flavorful. 
My aunt has Flu so I brought some chicken noodle soup after I ate.  Today she called me and want some more so I came again ate noodle soup today.  
Love the flavor but noodle itself was okay. I'm very picky about the noodle.  I like my noodle little bit under cook. 
I've tried all the side dishes.  It's all yummy.
I'm planning to come here at least once a week.

Growing up being raised by my very prideful Hainan Family, it is hard to beat their homemade Hainan Chicken! I heard about this new place in Vegas and needed soup desperately after a night in Vegas, y'all know what I mean. 

We had a party of 6 and since we are not here often, we decided to order all the appetizers/sides they have to offer so we can try it all! The black mushrooms and spicy beancurd were delicious! I also asked for extra chili oil on the side and they gave me a variety that I could choose; so thoughtful! My gf and I decided to get both the rice dish and soup so we can have the best of both worlds. I am a huge fan of white meat and she wanted dark so we got both. Let me just tell you, back home at our local Hainan chicken restaurant, the white meat is sooo dry and I must drench it in sauce to survive. But here, I had no problem doing a light dip! The white meat was so moist and tasteful, it kept me wanting more! 

The service was great. Our friend had a little accident of dropping the cup full of utensils, we were a bit embarrassed but we did not get any dirty looks and they kept it professional!

The food was amazing and it hit close to home. The decor was so nice and I loved how they added their own personal touches to it like the pug wall they had by the restroom! We put this at the top of our list as a must come back when we visit Las Vegas!

I was reading the reviews and just amused at some of the negative people and what they find to be negative about.
This is a small family run place that serves very good authentic chicken with fantastic rice. All of it was very delicious and to make it even better the owners are there as sweet as can be. 
Hard working people trying to make a business work in this city is hard enough and also very costly.
People that

If you are looking for good authentic Chinese food and are carefully crafted, you have to try this place. They specialize in poached chicken.  Only 2 entree on the menu. Chicken noodle soup and Hainan chicken and rice( a traditional dish  loved by many Chinese people).  Chicken are fresh from the farm and never been frozen.  They are the Chinese breed of chicken that are much more lean.  There are many side items worth getting.  The cloud ear mushroom and the cucumbers are well prepared too.  I have been here 3 times this week.

This place is bomb !! We started off with the cucumber salad, and the spicy bean curd, which had a good spicy kick to it. This place has most delicious hainan chicken I've had in Vegas !! The chicken is fresh free range, never frozen you can really taste the difference. I had the hainan chicken white meat boneless. The chicken was not dry, and the sauces that were provided pair well with the chicken. My boyfriend had the dark meat noodle soup, he said he can't believe there's no MSG in the broth and it was very flavorful. The service was excellent! Definitely will be going to this place often !!!!

Today is my second time eating at this place, I am planning to go eat here once or twice a week. Growing up in Hong Kong eating nothing but fresh farm-raised chicken. I didn't personally mind that they only had two main items on the menu, but I did have concerns for this restaurant, such as their low open hours, and lack of variety in the dishes. 

Just suggesting that from a business standpoint, they should think about maybe closing from 2:30till 6pm, and reopen from 6pm till 9pm, for those people who work straight through without a lunch break and that they should put at least more dishes on the menu for when people get tired. I gave 5 stars because I personally love those dishes.
must try their hainan chicken rice! it is the best I have ever tasted in Vegas. the ice lemon tea was also good.  will be back soon for sure.

So happy to have found this place in Vegas! I love their sauces. Good food, good price & good service. What more can you ask for? I have recommended this place to family and friends after my first visit and in a couple days I came back and i will be a regular now!

I've said before that Chinese cuisine is severely lacking in the valley so it's pretty refreshing to see more Chinese restaurants pop up recently. Nuro bistro is the third Hainan chicken restaurant I've tried in the area. Flock & Fowl remains my gold standard, while Big Wong's is my go-to hole-in-the-wall for cheap eats. We visited Nuro this past weekend, which had only been open for about two weeks. I like the simplicity of their menu, offering a chicken-based theme around the traditional chicken and rice as well as chicken noodle soup. 

We started our meal with the Nuro chicken wings, which looked very crispy. However, we were all quite disappointed after taking bites into the chicken wings only to discover that they weren't crispy at all. I liked the spicy lime sauce on the side, but chicken wings are meant to be crispy and these were very under-fried. 

Moving on to our entrees, I was quite impressed by the clean presentation of the chicken and rice, reminiscent of the plating from Flock & Fowl. We tried the breast meat, served with skin and bones for $9.75. It was served with three sauce options of soy, spicy chili, and a ginger scallion sauce. While the poached chicken was good, it was no where as tender as Flock & Fowl's and closer to that of Big Wong's (with a higher price point). The stock seasoned rice was average. As for the chicken noodle soup, I could appreciate the rice noodles and the broth, which was quite flavorful. But again, I found my poached chicken to be a little on the rubbery side. On top of that, the portion was small for $8.95 - I would've had much larger options had I gone to a Vietnamese restaurant and ordered ph gà. 

I did find the service to be excellent as we were frequently checked on; however, my last gripe was the Yelp check-in offer. My girlfriend and I got the lemon iced sweet tea and Vietnamese drip coffee respectively with the check-in (supposedly for free, but later mistakingly charged). I didn't realize until after I left and paid the bill that we were charged for those drinks, which I guess was also my fault for not looking at it more closely at the time of payment.
Staff was great service is phenomenal they are very attentive food however is blah at best. The condiments are exceptional but the food at least what I ate blah
The menus for a simple with not a lot of choices which makes it really nice IA like the chicken rice and I like the soup to and they're dipping sauces are a very good

The food here is simple, no frills and fantastic. The chicken noodle soup is exactly what I need after a stressful, stomach curling week. If I could eat this everyday, I totally would. The chicken is perfectly cooked so it's not tough or stringy and the broth is well-balanced in flavor, not overly salted. I feel like I've done my body a favor after eating it, instead of hating myself. Wish they stayed open later!

We came here to try the food , they don't have a lot option of food :( my husband he loves to eat Asian food I wish they can have more choices! , hainam chicken was ok , the pho bowl to small . Remind me in Asia country lol ! The chicken wings was nice and hot I , every single item needs to be more tasty . Good luck to them for the Business!!!

Brand new, super conveniently located 
 for delicious Hainan chicken. We were immediately welcomed by the friendly owners Tommy & Jessica who explained the menu in detail. My wife had the Hainan chicken and my daughter and I had the Hainan chicken noodle soup. All the chicken they use is free range and is very low on fat. The meat is super juicy and yummy. We found it very reasonably priced for a great portion. Definitely will be back!!!!

Nice appetizer dishes, yummy!!
Chicken wings, Hunan chicken, all delicious!!! Soft and melts in the mouth!! 

Rice was flavorful and well enough to go with the chicken.

Everything is fresh and you can taste the freshness. Place is located in a good spot and great area.

Good for quick meal and taken out. They close Tuesdays but other than that it's a good to go!!!

Happy to see there's a restaurant like this on my side of the town. Order the soup and it was very tasty and delish! Also got the hainam chicken rice, love all 3 of their dipping sauce!! I think it tastes better than flock and fowl. (IMO)  .....
the Hainan rice is way better than the soup (whose broth is too light). the wings are still good but gotta eat them fast before they get soggy.

Great flavor and simple selections. I'm a Hainanese chicken lover so, I proudly recommend this restaurant. It is as equally competitive to Flock & Fowl or better. Great prices & friendly services. You'd feel full and complete and your wallet intact after leaving the restaurant.

One tip: I think the ginger-scallion is slightly on the salty side. If they could add less salt then it would be perfect :)

Highly recommended if you're a fan of Hainan chicken!!! Super fresh chicken and tasty hainan chicken rice. Home-made soy milk is also a MUST. Owner Tommy is very helpful and explains the menu in detail. One of the places that I will definitely suggest to others!

The best hainan chicken in Las Vegas! Drove by it and decided to try this new place. The staff is attentive and informative. Food came out pretty quick.  You also have to try their home made soy milk! Will definitely come back!

Came here to try the chicken and rice and I loved it. I came to place an order to go and the girl helping me was very friendly. I told her it was my first time so she helped explain the menu to me. I checked in yelp for my free drink which I chose the ice tea which seem to be their popular drink. Ice tea was good but next time I want to come try their soy milk as well because I love me some soy milk. I got the normal chicken with rice. It came with 3 different sauces and I really liked the yellow orange sauce with red peppers in it. I put some of that sauce on the rice and used that as my main dipping sauce. The rice was flavored good and the chicken was so tender and melts in your mouth. I loved it and it's still good when you microwave leftovers. I really like the pickled vegetables they give you but it was only a little amount. I wish there was more. The inside of the restaurant was clean and cozy. Seem like a good spot to eat at. I definitely will come back here and I love their chicken and rice. This place is way better than flock and fowl in my opinion.

If you enjoy Hainan chicken, then their chicken would blow you away. Juicy, tender and fresh. And their rice is very well seasoned. The rice came with three different sauces, a garlic chili vinaigrette, grinned ginger oil and sweet soy, which didn't overpower the chicken but compliment it perfectly. Great stuff. Would be back soon.

The Hainanese chicken is truly good. The best way to eat it is to pour the ginger/scallion sauce into your steaming bowl of rice and use the other two sauces for the steamed chicken. The pig's ears is nicely seasoned - chewy n tasty

It's always a treat to find a place that serves excellent food. This place focuses on simple yet authentic food using only fresh quality ingredients. Their Hainanese Chicken, with matching rice, is flavorful, tender and juicy without being oily like other Chinese food. The Fried Chicken wings is coated in a light batter that makes it crispy on the outside but still tender inside. Their chicken soup has a very clean flavor and also very tasty, with the noodles cooked just right. The little condiments they served with their dishes compliment the food so well. 
With so many chain restaurants sprouting all over the city, it's nice to actually see local businesses with dedicated owners who actually are actively involved in the real operation of their restaurant. 
We live on the opposite side of town but we wouldn't mind driving for their food. It's really worth it! Keep up the good work guys!

The Hainan chicken rice and the Hainan chicken pho noodle soup are excellent. They get their fresh free range chicken daily. The meat is tender and juicy and so clean tasting. Love that the rice dish comes with 3 different dipping sauces. The pho has such a clean fresh chicken taste to it. The restaurant is very clean, the service is excellent, and the limited items they currently have are delicious. The owners are on site and very friendly and open to comments. Hope everyone will give this locally owned small business a try. We will keep coming back.

Love that I don't have to drive to spring mountain for my hainam chicken or pho ga!

Got to check out this spot today and geez - have I been missing out? Like I've heard big hype on their pho ga and chicken wings and this girl was not disappointed. 

First of all - the clean, contemporary atmosphere was amazing! And I actually loved the simplicity of the menu. It meets the atmosphere and concept of simplify that I took from my visit here today. 

Ok so the chicken wings remind me of what my Dad used to make me as a kid. Lighter, crispy, less battered. And the sauce for the chicken was soooo good. We also got a pho ga which is AMAZING. Like I think it could cure sickness with its deliciousness AND ITS MADE FRESH EVERY DAY (rare thing to happen in LV)! We also had their spicy bean curd - holy moly, it is a great mix and an extremely nice dish to start with. And my boyfriend loved their homemade soy milk!! I love the portion size and I think this is a great stop for lunch or a dinner! And I noticed they've extended their hours to 8pm, which is awesome!

The food was so good we had to bring my parents back some pho, hainam chicken, and some wings! They absolutely love it. Especially since I swear, that soup could cure sicknesses. But also, did I mention that their chicken is obtained fresh DAILY, FREE RANGE, and they do not cook with MSG!! I'm a huge fan of that detail alone!! 

I will definitely be back here and am so glad to find a place close to my home like this. Our bill was extremely reasonably priced (especially for the amount of fresh and high quality produce and products that they use)! 

Definitely think this place is a must try for everyone, especially if you love chicken! Also, super cute bentos for take out if you need meals for the week ;)! 

Last thing to point out is the service there is great. The owners came and talked to us, and it was so sweet to have them come check on us often to see what we thought of their food! Thank you so much for the great hospitality! Well be back soon!

Nuro Bistro popped up on my Instagram a week ago and I've been drooling over their pictures ever since, so when I was in the area today I knew I had to pop by!

They only have one entrance, which can be confusing if you park in the back but just walk around the building.

Let me start by saying that all of the employees were SO friendly! From our waiter to the chef himself, everyone went out of their way to make sure that our questions were answered, our food was to our liking, and our leftovers boxed up when we were ready to leave.

But most importantly, THE FOOD is AMAZING. I've been looking for authentic Hainan chicken (or as we called it in Thailand, khao mun gai) in Las Vegas forever, and this places nails it. From their perfectly oiled rice, to the fresh chicken, all the way to their perfect sweet/spicy Nuro sauce, my dish was perfect from the first to the last bite. My husband got the chicken noodle soup which got a thumbs up from both of us as well.

Also there are photos (and paintings) of the owner's pugs all over the restaurant, which I'm obviously a fan of.  

I will definitely be back!

Had chicken rice and chicken noodle.  The chicken was tough in both dishes.  I agree with Adrian L, the quality of the chicken rice is not up to standard. Price was too high and there was extra charge for everything. We wouldn't be returning.

Always excited to have more Asian food expanding to the West side of town.  The menu is simple, this is a Chinese-American style Hainan chicken.  I preferred the flavored rice over the noodle soup as the flavor of the soup is light and delicate.  The soup is the same base used to flavor the rice too.

The meal portion is on the smaller side and it's the main reason for one less star as all four in our party were hungry in 2 hours.  I think next time we would order 3 meals plus a whole chicken so there is enough to be filled.

Service is great and all the staff are communicative and friendly.  Place is also clean with light and airy decor.

This is easily one of the most unique meals I have ever eaten! The chicken and rice plate is incredibly delicious and downright feel good food. I have never had such flavorful "white" rice, because it isn't just a scoop of plain steamed rice... this rice has such depth with flavors of chicken, ginger, and garlic actually cooked into it! If you eat just a spoonful of rice by itself, you'll know exactly the savoryness I speak of! The chicken is just as delicious and beyond tender. My one and only qualm with this meal is that the skin is a bit off putting since it isn't crispy. I personally just take it off as it's more soggy and rubbery than I would like. Now, there's 3 dipping sauces that come with the meal as well as a little pickled accoutrement. I have no idea what the three dipping sauces are called, but one is like a sweet soy, another sort of a spicy, tangy vinegar, and the last is the BEST savory, lemongrass, ginger, scalliony oil. I LOVE the last one, but the other two get some dipping action as well! Seriously though, the chicken dunked in the ginger scallion oil with a forkful of rice is therapeutic. The first time I went here I also ordered the iced coffee and cucumber appetizer. Both were yummy, but I have come back every time for the chicken plate. It is such a tasty, unforgettable, and comforting meal. Seriously, I took my coworkers here the same week I tried it solo because I was yearning to have that chicken and rice and dip again!!

I am so glad that we decided to try this place. Everything was beautifully presented and very tasty! I especially loved the variety of homemade sauces that came with the meal. The chicken wings are a must try!  Service was exceptional and the staff was very knowledgeable and willing to explain everything on the menu. I will definitely be back very soon! :)
So good. Fresh. Tasty. Great sauces and portion size. Would come here again in a heartbeat

Great place and atmosphere, loved everything they have done with the place. Served the dishes well and they have given exceptional customer service. If you wanna try something new with the L.A. vibe then definitely check this place out. They won't disappoint.

The Good
Omg there's another chicken rice place in town! And in the west side! Yay! I seriously hope chicken becomes like poke, with stores everywhere.  They do a pretty good job with the flavored rice.  We ordered a whole chicken to share and the portion size was very generous. Price is also very fair.

The Bad
The chicken could be more tender.  The "whole chicken" order only comes with one type of sauce.  However, when you order the chicken and rice combo, that comes with all three sauces.  They allowed us to get all 3 sauces for a nominal fee, but that just felt kind of petty.  Parking was also awkward.  I guess we parked at the back of the store and had to walk through a very graffitied alleyway.  Staff was fairly inattentive and also delivered wrong food to our table. 

The Ugly
They didn't shave the chickens! Our chicken skin was covered with long long 1.5 inches+ chunks of hair. Eww.  I mean that is some serious faux pas in the Chinese food world.  It's fairly disgusting and I really hope they fix it ASAP.  This is like the one thing that I would have a hard time overlooking.

First timer at Nuro Bistro. Had to come by after reading and seeing all the great reviews. I'm local so I was happy to find out Hainan chicken joint opened recently. 

Sad to say I was not impressed. As soon as walked in, I was never greeted by the hostess standing next to the door behind the register just staring at me. The waiter serving other and walking around just casually walked passed me without a word. After a awkward 2 mins I just asked if I can sit anywhere. Mind you, it was not crowded and kinda slow 

Order the hainan chicken with some pig ears. Good flavor on the chicken, not enough meat. I felt like I was just trying to bite through the bone and get to the little meat they had on it. 

Pig ear was solid tho. For the price of $5-6ish I guess it's decent. Haninan (chicken and rice) was about $9 plus $1 for dark meat option. Comes with 3 different dipping sauce. 

They have other option on the menu but sad to say I probably won't be coming back.. 

Although I have to say it has room for growth and lots of potential in the long run.

If you have a craving for Hainan chicken, this is the place! Casual setting with delicious food and friendly service. 

My Recommendation:

1. Hainan Chicken Rice Combo with your preference of white or dark meat.
2. Feeling adventurous? Try the Braised Pig Ear.

This place just opened up and I'm really glad I gave it a try. I ordered the hainan chicken rice. The texture of the chicken was great. The owner told me they pick up free range chicken every morning! I also liked that they served the food on a baking tray instead of usual plates. It's little different things like this that make your experience better. The staff was really friendly as well. My favorite thing though has got to be the pug wall!!

Flavors. Awesome!  Quality. Awesome. 
Now the personal gripes.  I loved the rice and seasoning.  The chicken portion was flat out sad.  Hainan chicken and rice means you have a costar.  This was a guest appearance at best. My young son commented on the chicken portion!  When you have as much bone remaining after you've eaten as the portion of chicken served??  Yea.
The chicken rice was very good, love the ginger sauce. Pig ear appetizer was great too (but better with chili than the red vinegar). Cozy restaurant interior.

I've driven past Nuro bistro several times and I finally got to see what it was all about. The location is easily accessible and thanks to their large white sign on an orange building you can see it from a distance. The front doors are lovely. The menu is very simple. There are about 6 appetisers and 2 entrees to choose from. I had the Hainan Chicken Rice with dark meat. The chicken comes poached(which the menu says) with stock cooked white rice(WHICH IS SO FREAKING DELICIOUS I COULD HAVE HAD ONLY RICE AND BEEN SO THRILLED) as well as 3 sauces. My favourite sauce was the scallion and garlic, which I mixed in with my rice. There is a disclaimer about the chicken as it's bone in and then cut. Now, I understand why they do it bone in, but you do have to work for it a little to ensure you don't swallow any bones. I peeled my chicken off the bone and tossed it into my rice to have a nice little bowl for lunch. Their soy sauce is on the sweeter side which I enjoyed very much. 
I also had the fresh cucumber app. It was tossed in a garlic ginger dressing which was very good. 

I did see a review where someone had uncut chicken, perhaps they do this on request for those snobbies who wouldn't want to pick at bones.

Came here one day for lunch with my husband and friend. When I saw this new restaurant, I had to try it because it specialized in Hainan chicken. We all love the dish and sometimes, I would even make it at home. We typically usually go to Flock n Fowl for Hainan chicken but they're a little far sometimes. The hours for Nuro are a little weird though because of their hours. They close pretty early so it's hard to come here during the weekdays when I have work. 

They have HONG KONG STYLED LEMON ICED TEA!! Vegas lacks Hong Kong styled cafes and it's really nice to know that Nuro incorporates a little of it in their menu. Also, if you check in on yelp, they have an offer for a free drink! 

We all got an order of their Hainan chicken because that's their specialty. I wanted to try their chicken wings too but we can't eat that much food. And their chicken noodle soup looked really good as well cause it was a little chilly that day. In fact, their establishment was a little chilly as well. I had to keep my coat on while my friend had to grab his coat from his car. 

They have white meat and for a dollar more, you can order the dish with just dark meat. I'm not quite sure how that works because when we got our dish, it looked like a combination versus JUST white meat. Maybe their dark meat option just gave you legs and thighs? Haha. 

Their chicken is not de-boned, unlike many other Hainan chicken restaurants that I have tried. Granted, all the other Hainan chicken places were either Thai style or Singaporean styled. Nuro's chicken actually reminded me a lot of a Cantonese styled chicken ??? "Empress chicken." So I just assumed they were Canton styled and judging from the owner's comments, I was right. 

Each Hainan chicken dish came with three sauces: the traditional ginger and scallion sauce, a soy based sauce, and a vinaigrette? I only used the ginger and scallion sauce as that is my favorite sauce to eat chicken with. Nuro's version of the sauce is delicious -- it has just enough salt in the sauce. Their chicken, however, could be considered on the dry side. A lot of other Hainan places that I have had, the chicken was always juicy and tender but Nuro's was not. It's not necessarily bad as my family is from Hong Kong so their style is very comforting. Their chicken rice is pretty good as well -- although I just wish the rice wasn't as mushy. I prefer rice that's more towards the firmer side. 

Their HK styled lemon ice tea was a little on the disappointing side. HK styled lemon ice tea needs to be SWEET. Nuro's version, however, lacked the sweetness to their tea. If they could just make it sweeter and had more lemon slices, it'll be perfect. 

Overall, Nuro is good. People won't be used to it though. My husband did not appreciate the bones in his chicken. I enjoyed my meal but would have preferred the chicken to be more tender.
Chicken is sooo GOOODD! The soup with added spice is amazing! The sauces with the rice were a little on the plain side and the chicken had a lot of lose bones. Service was .

EXCELLENT FOOD! Their chicken is so juicy and cook just right. Love the dipping sauce that goes with the chicken.  Their soup is very good too.  Everything there is delicious! We will be back for more. Customer service is good too. The waiter speak perfect English.  That's a plus. The place is very clean too. Wish price would be a little bit lower.

This place wouldn't have been on my radar if it wasn't for my mom. I'm not usually a huge fan of Chinese food but wow this was so tasty and fresh. I had the Chicken Noodle Soup with dark meat. They were very nice and let me try both Spicy Nuro sauce and Ginger Scallion sauce. My favorite was the Ginger Scallion sauce. I also had the Hong Kong Style Lemon Iced Sweet Tea which was very refreshing. Our server John was super friendly and kept coming with the refills. He even offered to get me a to-go cup which of course I accepted! Very calming and welcoming atmosphere. If I lived in NV, I would definitely come back.

Ate here a few weeks ago with a friend right after they first opened. I had the hainan chicken and it was really fresh. And I love Hainan chicken. The sauces were the best part. Very flavorful. Also had the chicken wings for appetizer which was pretty big and juicy and but they were really hot so make sure you wait a few minutes before digging in. Overall would come back to try some of their other dishes.

A new spot to get Hainan Chicken, Nuro Bistro's version is delightful.  We visited over the weekend and the place was kinda empty, but that meant more attention for us.  Hainan Chicken is a fairly simple dish of poached chicken served with three sauces (garlic scallion, house soy sauce, and Nuro spicy) plus stock-flavored rice--the garlic sauce was my favorite. I got the breast meat meal and the dish came out quickly and was very flavorful.  I also ordered the fresh cucumber as an appetizer and liked the garlic vinaigrette with that, as well.  Use your Yelp check-in for a free drink--I had the Hong Kong style lemon iced sweet tea and there were multiple refills.  Our server was attentive (not hard when it was just us and another table of customers) and the restaurant is spacious and modern.  I will definitely be back.

Finally! A bomb Hainan chicken place in Vegas! Coming from LA, SGV to be exact, I've developed a high standard for Hainan chicken .. lol so when I found this place I definitely had to stop by. I got the Hainan Chicken rice & the SO got the noodle soup. They were both on point! The chicken was super juicy and the soup & rice were very flavorful. I'm also a sauce snob and I loved them all - especially their house sauce. We were also pleasantly surprised that they have HK lemon iced tea! That's a staple for SGV cafe & we'd always buy some when we went back home to visit. It's nice to know that there's a restaurant in Vegas that could make us feel like we're back home!

This place is awesome! My new favorite.
Hainan chicken is perfect. Not too salty not bland. 
The menu is simple. The place is clean. Place is not loud.
Great place for business lunch.

Good place to get Hainan chicken. It is basically their specialty as they keep the menu small (usually a good thing, particularly for a small restaurant). The chicken tastes fresh and, importantly, they do a nice job with the rice. The price is reasonable. The choice of sauces is nice to have. Thumbs up.

Brand new restaurant and conveniently located by my house. Their Hainan Chicken rice is very tasty. The chicken is very tender and juicy and it comes with 3 different dipping sauces. Their soy milk taste really fresh and it's homemade. I will definitely recommend to my friends and family to try.

Finally! I always crave Asian food when I'm in Vegas and now there's actually a place to eat at. 

Love this new spot! Their hainan chicken is tender, delicate, and somehow I ate the entire portion. I also got the bean curd which was fresh and perfectly seasoned but I was sooo full I didn't get to try the other sides 

Don't miss the soymilk either, I can't believe they make it from scratch soy beans every day. You can really taste the difference. 

Thanks Nuro! I look forward to returning

A little restaurant with delectable food. The chicken was delicious, the sauces were amazing and the service spot on! The decor is adorable and atmosphere pretty relaxing. I will definitely return with more people in the future.

These guys are so nice!  We came in on a saturday to try their Hainan chicken.  I was happy to have a location on this side of town, since Flock and Fowl is a bit far.

Food was excellent - warning that the chicken does come with the bone own (vs. Flock and Fowl which debones it for you), so it requires more effort, but still delicious.  They were missing the chilli sauce, but they readily made some for my friend when asked.

They had HK style lemon tea with free refills!  As we were leaving, they offered to top us off and give us a to-go cup.

Overall glad to have more Hainan chicken options :)

Side note - I wish they had a decent vegetarian option -- another friend would have joined us but she doesn't eat meat.  Having a main she could have eaten too would have been nice!

Always excited to try out new spots in Vegas! This one is definitely a surprise because there aren't many places that sells Hainan chicken! Many people know that Hainan chicken is a staple dish in Singapore & there just isn't a place in Vegas that has this delicacy! Definitely worth stopping by to check it out if you are a fan of chicken 

The chicken noodle pho comes with a nice, clear broth & the option of chicken breast or dark meat without bones. I opted out for the chicken breast, with skin. The broth & chicken is not too salty, which makes the signature nuro sauce stand out. 

Another plus is that their hong kong style iced itea comes with free refills!!

Wow!! Wow!! Wow!!  This is exactly what I've been looking for the right Hainan chicken rice.  I can just finish two bowls of rice by myself, SOOO good, very authentic.   I thought I could only find it in Hong Kong.
Now, the chicken.  After you had the chicken, you'll know how chicken should taste.  I am so sick of frozen ckicken and chicken that taste like card board in US.  
They have a lot of cute designs of cups for tea.  I had their favourite Pug cup and it is so cute I want to buy it from them.
Service is great and friendly .
I love the decor in store.  Nuro will be my place for Hainan chicken in Vegas from now on.  Thank you chef!

I love hainan chicken with rice and as far as I know there are only a few places to get it in Vegas.  Tung ky (chinese bbq) a small cash only place, flock and fowl, and here.  This was my first time trying Nuro and it has became my favorite spot for hainan chicken.  

Rice: the rice was on point,  Nuro's wasnt as greasy, it was lighter, and it comes with more than other places. It was so good next time i'm getting an extra bowl. 

Chicken: the chicken was perfect.  I got the white meat but it wasnt dry, it was soft and flavorful, and the temperature was just right. 

Sauces:  I like the ginger sauce the best, followed by the tangy sauce not sure what it was, and the say sauce the least. This is all just my preference tho. None of the sauces were bad at all.

This has nothing to do with the food but getting served in a metal tray was probably for convenience to easily carry the sauces, the rice, and the chicken in one tray but being that it was metal was a little out of place as the environment is a nice cozy comforting and newer decor and clean environment.  Then here comes a metal prison tray lol. Its all good though, im there for the flavor of the food.

Cant wait to go back to try the soup!
